comments:
Build F2

Had an editor on a unit which got discarded, the editor did not get closed.
When double-clicking on its title area, got the following entry in the log.

Editor would not close passed that point.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Jun 06, 2002 18:53:51.04

Approved for F3 by NE and KH.

I don't remember quite how I got there, but noticed an error when doing the 
following:

1. create project P, with source unit X.java.
2. open X.java in editor
3. exit Eclipse
4. go to file system, discard folder corresponding to project P
5. restart Eclipse, error dialog since could not reopen X.java

!SESSION Jun 10, 2002 17:33:11.915 ---------------------------------------------
java.version=1.4.1-beta
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -ws win32 -data D:\eclipse\workspaces\dev2.0\plugins -
refresh -debug -consoleLog D:\jdk1.4.1 -install file:D:/eclipse/sdk/eclipse/
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.resources 4 567 Jun 10, 2002 17:33:11.915
!MESSAGE Problems occurred while restoring the workspace.
!SUBENTRY 1 org.eclipse.core.resources 4 567 Jun 10, 2002 17:33:11.915
!MESSAGE The project description file (.project) for Crap2 is missing.  This 
file contains important information about the project.  The project will not 
function properly until this file is restored.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Jun 10, 2002 17:34:04.931
!MESSAGE Unable to restore editor - createElement returned null for input 
element factory: org.eclipse.ui.part.FileEditorInputFactory

Yes, but that is expected since the file does not exist anymore and it is not a 
walkback it is just a dialog informing the user that the workbench state could 
not be restore as it was before. We have room for improvent in terms of the 
message and the dialog we are showing the user (after 2.0).

I am closing this report as WORKSFORME. Please reopen it if you see this error 
again.
